intro: Paepalanthus vellozioides, commonly known as the Zonolite plant, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that come in shades of red, orange, and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at high altitudes, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its unique floral structure and vibrant colors make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The species is also valued for its ability to thrive in challenging conditions, making it a resilient addition to botanical collections.
